com.facebook.litho.testing.viewtree

Class ViewTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.litho.testing.viewtree.ViewTree

  • public final class ViewTree
extends Object
    This is a helper class to allow asserting on view trees and recursively verify predicates on its nodes within the narrow abilities that Robolectric affords us.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      <any> findChild(<any> predicate)
      Find a view in the hierarchy for which the given predicate is true

      Find a view in the hierarchy for which the given predicate is true, while only check children of nodes as directed by the additional shouldCheckChildren predicate
      View getRoot()

      Generates a string describing the views tree using the views' toString methods and an extra information function.

        public static ViewTree of(View view)

      • getRoot

        public View getRoot()
        Returns:

      • findChild

        public <any> findChild(<any> predicate)
        Find a view in the hierarchy for which the given predicate is true
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to find a view upholding
        Returns:
        null if no such view is found, or a list showing the path in the hierarchy to the view for which the predicate holds

      • findChild

        public <any> findChild(<any> predicate,
                       <any> shouldCheckChildren)
        Find a view in the hierarchy for which the given predicate is true, while only check children of nodes as directed by the additional shouldCheckChildren predicate
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to find a view upholding
        shouldCheckChildren - a predicate to decide whether to
        Returns:
        null if no such view is found, or a list showing the path in the hierarchy to the view for which the predicate holds

      • makeString

        public String makeString(<any> extraTextFunction)
        Generates a string describing the views tree using the views' toString methods and an extra information function.

        The output is a string, with each view of the tree in its own line, indented according to its depth in the tree, and then the extra information supplied by teh function.

        This can be used, for example, to print all views and their respective text and is useful for when assertions fail.

        Parameters:
        extraTextFunction - the function returning extra information to print per view, or null if not extra information should be printed
        Returns:
        a string describing the tree
